In the wake of 
      the Enron bankruptcy both FERC and the FTC and industry players are making 
      dramatic changes in contracting. Attendees will learn of the new 
      directions and the implications for their businesses. The seminar will 
      update and compare the EEI, ISDA, and NAESB form contracts and discuss 
      challenges to their use as well as the new FERC Market Behavior Rules.  


      This one-day seminar has been accredited for 7.25 CLE Credits & 
      .50 Ethics.


      Outline

Overview of Energy Trading 
        & Marketing
Federal Energy Regulatory Commission
Commodity Futures Trading Commission
Bankruptcy and 
        Other Federal Laws
Don't Forget State Regulations
Contracts For 
        Energy Trading & Marketing
Energy Ethics
Energy Case 
        Studies: Apply Laws, Regulations and Ethics












Professionals 
      new to the energy field and anyone that wants or needs to get current on 
      all the new developments should attend this seminar. Lawyers, traders, 
      credit, regulatory and other back office personnel will also find this 
      seminar extremely valuable. 






Mark Haedicke 
      teaches energy and business law at the University of Houston. He has 
      worked in the energy business for nearly 25 years, helping lead the 
      development of master contracts for energy, most recently as managing 
      director and general counsel with UBS Warburg Energy. He is now a 
      principal at Energy Consulting Services LLC where he focuses on energy 
      trading, risk management, and energy litigation. He was a board director 
      of the International Swap and Derivatives Association (ISDA) for six 
      years.
